subject: No detailed test result info -- why?
msgSnippet: Hi all! I m running a single test in a Junit test that I launch via Ant. My results look like this: [junit] Running
messageBody:
Hi all!

I'm running a single test in a Junit test that I launch
via Ant.

My results look like this:

[junit] Running com.wellsfargo.ibk.ivs.TestIndexSearchAdapter
[junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
[junit] TEST com.wellsfargo.ibk.ivs.TestIndexSearchAdapter FAILED

So I see I have an error there, but I see no information about
which tests were run, or, if I got an uncaught exception,
I see no stacktrace either.

How can I specify, either in the test itself or in my Ant
build.xml file, that I want it to tell me which test is
being run, where it failed, etc?

I am doing a lot of stuff in setUp(), including stuff that
may cause an uncaught exception. Would that cause the mysterious
error I'm seeing?

I put println()'s into the code, but they are never displayed.
How can I tell the TestRunner I want to see them? I assume that
stdout is being caught and not displayed, correct?

- Tim
